data.job_description:
About the Role

Join HH Red Stone, a fast-growing real estate management firm transforming how properties connect with residents, partners, and investors through digital innovation. We’re seeking a creative and data-driven Digital Marketing Coordinator to elevate our online presence across property management and investment platforms.

In this role, you’ll lead social media strategy, manage online brand content, and drive SEO and digital marketing initiatives that enhance visibility, engagement, and lead generation. It’s an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives at the intersection of creativity and analytics — combining storytelling, brand strategy, and performance tracking to strengthen HH Red Stone’s reputation across multiple markets.

Key Responsibilities

Social Media Management
• Develop and execute multi-platform social media strategies (LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, and emerging channels).
• Create, schedule, and publish engaging content highlighting company culture, properties, events, and initiatives.
• Partner with property teams to source high-quality content and maintain a consistent brand voice.
• Monitor engagement metrics and optimize content for reach, relevance, and conversion.

Digital & SEO Marketing
• Manage and optimize website and landing page content for SEO performance.
• Conduct keyword research and collaborate with IT to ensure SEO best practices are implemented.
• Monitor Google Analytics and social insights to identify trends and actionable opportunities.
• Support paid digital campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn) in partnership with vendors or internal teams.

Brand & Communications Support
• Ensure brand consistency across all platforms and marketing materials.
• Collaborate with Business Development and Operations teams to support campaigns, press releases, and email marketing initiatives.
• Assist with newsletters, blog articles, and event promotion.
• Maintain the digital asset library (photos, videos, brand templates, etc.).

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Digital Media, or related field.
• 2+ years of experience in digital marketing or social media (real estate experience a plus).
• Strong understanding of SEO, Google Analytics, and social media analytics tools.
• Proficiency with Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar design tools.
• Excellent writing, editing, and organizational skills.
• Ability to work independently while collaborating across departments.

Why HH Red Stone

Join a growing property management company with a creative, fast-paced environment and a culture built on collaboration, performance, and innovation. You’ll play a key role in shaping how our story is told across digital channels and help drive the continued growth of our national platform.

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Digital Media, or related field
Strong understanding of SEO, Google Analytics, and social media analytics tools
Proficiency with Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar design tools
Excellent writing, editing, and organizational skills
Ability to work independently while collaborating across departments
Benefits: Maintain the digital asset library (photos, videos, brand templates, etc.)
Responsibilities: In this role, you’ll lead social media strategy, manage online brand content, and drive SEO and digital marketing initiatives that enhance visibility, engagement, and lead generation

It’s an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives at the intersection of creativity and analytics — combining storytelling, brand strategy, and performance tracking to strengthen HH Red Stone’s reputation across multiple markets
Social Media Management
Develop and execute multi-platform social media strategies (LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, and emerging channels)
Create, schedule, and publish engaging content highlighting company culture, properties, events, and initiatives
Partner with property teams to source high-quality content and maintain a consistent brand voice
Monitor engagement metrics and optimize content for reach, relevance, and conversion
Digital & SEO Marketing

Conduct keyword research and collaborate with IT to ensure SEO best practices are implemented
Monitor Google Analytics and social insights to identify trends and actionable opportunities
Support paid digital campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn) in partnership with vendors or internal teams

Collaborate with Business Development and Operations teams to support campaigns, press releases, and email marketing initiatives
Assist with newsletters, blog articles, and event promotion

data.job_description:
Job Summary

The Digital Marketing Specialist - Cell & Gene Therapy (CGT) Technologies leads the development and execution of integrated digital marketing strategies that drive audience engagement, brand equity, and commercial success. This role partners with cross-functional teams and external agencies to deliver innovative, compliant, and personalized content across all digital channels, leveraging advanced analytics and industry best practices to optimize performance and achieve strategic business objectives.
• Position may be worked remotely, with willingness and ability to travel to Lake Zurich, IL to engage with cross-functional teams.

This position is unable to offer sponsorship either now or in the future

Base Salary Range: $80,000-85,000
Final pay determinations will depend on various factors, including, but not limited to experience level, education level, knowledge, skills, and abilities.

Responsibilities
• Design and execute integrated digital marketing campaigns to assist commercial business in the digital space.
• Assist in the development of digital content for web, LinkedIn, email, and other digital channels to drive engagement.
• Follow promotional review and approval processes, as well as distribution guidelines, to ensure efficiency and compliance across digital marketing activities.
• Manage digital calendar and oversee execution of digital campaigns to ensure timely distribution aligned with key commercial milestones.
• Collect performance analytics using analytics tools to measure effectiveness and reports insights to key stakeholders to support data-driven future optimization strategies.
• Implement ongoing web optimization techniques to improve web performance.

Job Requirements
• Bachelor's degree required.
• 3+ years of digital marketing experience with a focus on digital campaign management, analytics, and optimization.
• Knowledge of web analytics, such as SEO/SEM, AEO, and GEO.
• Experience with the following digital platforms: Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Analytics, Salesforce Applications, and Veeva.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite of software.
• Ability to travel up to 15 percent for customer engagements, team engagements, and conferences, as well as willingness and ability to travel to Lake Zurich, IL to engage with cross-functional teams

Additional Information

We offer an excellent salary and benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as life insurance, disability,401K with company contribution, andwellness program.

Fresenius Kabi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, immigration status, disabilities, or protected veteran status.

Qualifications: Bachelor's degree required
3+ years of digital marketing experience with a focus on digital campaign management, analytics, and optimization
Knowledge of web analytics, such as SEO/SEM, AEO, and GEO
Experience with the following digital platforms: Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Analytics, Salesforce Applications, and Veeva
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite of software
Ability to travel up to 15 percent for customer engagements, team engagements, and conferences, as well as willingness and ability to travel to Lake Zurich, IL to engage with cross-functional teams
Benefits: Base Salary Range: $80,000-85,000
Final pay determinations will depend on various factors, including, but not limited to experience level, education level, knowledge, skills, and abilities
We offer an excellent salary and benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as life insurance, disability,401K with company contribution, andwellness program
Responsibilities: This role partners with cross-functional teams and external agencies to deliver innovative, compliant, and personalized content across all digital channels, leveraging advanced analytics and industry best practices to optimize performance and achieve strategic business objectives
Position may be worked remotely, with willingness and ability to travel to Lake Zurich, IL to engage with cross-functional teams

data.job_description:
Alarm.com is seeking a dynamic and innovative Digital Marketing Specialist with proven experience in web content management, search engine optimization (SEO), and A/B testing to drive high-impact digital marketing strategies. In this key role, you will combine creative and technical skills to support the Alarm.com Marketing Department by developing compelling, optimized content and closely analyzing performance data. You will evaluate content effectiveness through keyword rankings, organic traffic growth, conversion rates, and other SEO metrics, using insights to refine strategies and maximize online visibility and engagement.

What You'll Do:

Web Content Management
• Update and manage web content using CMS tools (e.g., WordPress, Craft).
• Create, edit, and optimize content for web pages, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines and SEO best practices.
• Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and implement content calendars.
• Design and execute A/B optimization tests to increase the effectiveness of various marketing strategies, landing pages, and user experiences.
• Monitor and analyze content performance metrics to provide actionable insights that drive continuous improvement and higher conversion rates.
• Utilize Google Analytics to track and report on site performance.

SEO Programs
• Conduct keyword research and implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies.
• Perform ongoing keyword discovery and expansion.
• Optimize website content and structure to improve visibility in AI-driven search results.
• Utilize SEO tools such as Google Search Console, SEMrush, or Ahrefs to monitor and improve site performance.

Email Marketing
• Collaborate with team to develop and implement targeted email marketing campaigns.
• Monitor and analyze email campaign performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations to optimize future campaigns and improve engagement rates.
• Other duties as assigned.

What We're Looking For:
• 3+ years of experience in digital marketing, SEO, and content management.
• Hands-on experience with SEO tools and A/B testing platforms.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Certifications in Google Analytics (Preferred).
• Experience with project management tools like JIRA and Confluence.
• Email marketing experience including creating campaigns, analyzing performance data, and optimizing strategies.
• Knowledge of AI algorithms and tools to enhance search engine rankings preferred.

Please note that sponsorship of new applicants for employment authorization, or any other immigration-related support, is not available for this position at this time.

Why work for Alarm.com?
• Collaborate with outstanding people: We hire only the best. Our standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.
• Make an immediate impact: New employees can expect to be given real responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the Alarm.com team!
• Gain well rounded experience: Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and develop expertise across multiple areas of the business.
• Focus on fun: Alarm.com places high value on our team culture. We even have a committee dedicated to hosting a stand-out holiday party, happy hours, and other fun corporate events.
• Alarm.com values working together and collaborating in person. Our employees work from the office 4 days a week.

COMPANY INFO

Alarm.com is the leading cloud-based platform for smart security and the Internet of Things. More than 7.6 million home and business owners depend on our solutions every day to make their properties safer, smarter, and more efficient. And every day, we're innovating new technologies in rapidly evolving spaces including AI, video analytics, facial recognition, machine learning, energy analytics, and more. We're seeking those who are passionate about creating change through technology and who want to make a lasting impact on the world around them.

For more information, please visit www.alarm.com.

COMPANY BENEFITS

Alarm.com offers competitive pay and benefits inclusive of subsidized medical plan options, an HSA with generous company contribution, a 401(k) with employer match, and paid holidays, wellness time, and vacation increasing with tenure. Paid maternity and bonding leave, company-paid disability and life insurance, FSAs, well-being resources and activities, and a casual dress work environment are also part of our outstanding total rewards package!

Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer

In connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you ("Personal Information"). The categories of Personal Information that we may collect include your name, government-issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information. We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future positions, recordkeeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies. By submitting your application, you acknowledge that we may retain some of the personal data that you provide in your application for our internal operations such as managing our recruitment system and ensuring that we comply with labor laws and regulations even after we have made our employment decision.

Notice To Third Party Agencies:
Alarm.com understands the value of professional recruiting services. However, we are not accepting resumes from recruiters or employment agencies for this position. In the event we receive a resume or candidate referral for this position from a third-party recruiter or agency without a previously signed agreement, we reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to you. If you are interested in working with Alarm.com, please email your company information and standard agreement to RecruitingPartnerships@Alarm.com.

Qualifications: 3+ years of experience in digital marketing, SEO, and content management
Hands-on experience with SEO tools and A/B testing platforms
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with project management tools like JIRA and Confluence
Email marketing experience including creating campaigns, analyzing performance data, and optimizing strategies
Benefits: Gain well rounded experience: Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and develop expertise across multiple areas of the business
Focus on fun: Alarm.com places high value on our team culture

Alarm.com offers competitive pay and benefits inclusive of subsidized medical plan options, an HSA with generous company contribution, a 401(k) with employer match, and paid holidays, wellness time, and vacation increasing with tenure

Paid maternity and bonding leave, company-paid disability and life insurance, FSAs, well-being resources and activities, and a casual dress work environment are also part of our outstanding total rewards package!
Responsibilities: In this key role, you will combine creative and technical skills to support the Alarm.com Marketing Department by developing compelling, optimized content and closely analyzing performance data

You will evaluate content effectiveness through keyword rankings, organic traffic growth, conversion rates, and other SEO metrics, using insights to refine strategies and maximize online visibility and engagement
Web Content Management
Update and manage web content using CMS tools (e.g., WordPress, Craft)
Create, edit, and optimize content for web pages, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines and SEO best practices
Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and implement content calendars
Design and execute A/B optimization tests to increase the effectiveness of various marketing strategies, landing pages, and user experiences
Monitor and analyze content performance metrics to provide actionable insights that drive continuous improvement and higher conversion rates
Utilize Google Analytics to track and report on site performance

About the position

Responsibilities
• Develop engaging digital marketing strategies to promote organizational goals and initiatives.
• Implement and manage high-quality content, including digital media, videos, graphics, and other visual elements, across various platforms.
• Use data-driven insights to refine content and marketing strategies for better quality and performance.
• Collaborate across the organization for critical insights to inform high-quality and effective communication products.
• Use current market trends to inform best practices in digital marketing and communication strategies.
• Ensure content is aligned with the organizational goals and brand guidelines for consistent and cohesive messaging.
• Create and implement social media strategies across different platforms.
• Improve communication products to capture target audiences and achieve target engagement goals.

Requirements
• Degree or certificate in marketing, communications, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
• 3+ years of experience working in digital marketing, preferably with a military or government context.
• Strong understanding of digital marketing tools, strategies, and tactics.
• Experience with utilizing search engines.
• Basic knowledge of web development and improving user experience.
• Proficient in digital marketing and communications tools.
• Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with all levels of management.
• A collaborative and engaging nature.
• Has a proactive mindset and can use critical thinking skills to inform decision-making.
• Ability to be flexible and adapt to different priorities in a fast-paced environment.
• Excellent work ethic and excellent organizational, written, and verbal communication skills with the ability to tailor messaging to different audiences.
• Ability to travel as required.
• Secret clearance required.

Benefits
• Competitive salary
• Comprehensive health plan including dental and vision coverage
• Company-paid life & disability insurance policies
• 401(k) plan with company match
• Educational reimbursement program

data.job_description:
NoeCee Global is actively seeking passionate individuals to join our dynamic team in an Entry-Level Marketing role. If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is eager to learn and grow, this could be the perfect opportunity for you! You will serve as a key face-to-face point of contact for our clients and their customers, helping to enhance brand visibility and drive sales.

Key Responsibilities:
• Foster strong relationships through clear communication with both clients and customers
• Participate in in-office meetings to collaborate and align with the team
• Learn about client products and services to effectively represent and promote them
• Assist in sales, new account setup, and lead generation efforts
• Contribute to brand awareness and promotional initiatives for our clients

What You Bring:
• Exceptional communication skills with the ability to engage clients and customers
• Strong interpersonal skills, and the potential for leadership
• A high school diploma or equivalent (higher education is a plus)
• An ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced work environment

What We Offer:
• Growth Opportunity: Room for advancement and career progression
• Paid Training: We invest in your success and provide comprehensive training
• Weekly Pay + Uncapped Bonus Opportunities
• All-Expenses Paid Travel Opportunities

Location:

McLean, VA

Qualifications: Exceptional communication skills with the ability to engage clients and customers
Strong interpersonal skills, and the potential for leadership
An ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced work environment
Benefits: Growth Opportunity: Room for advancement and career progression
Paid Training: We invest in your success and provide comprehensive training
Weekly Pay + Uncapped Bonus Opportunities
All-Expenses Paid Travel Opportunities

Foster strong relationships through clear communication with both clients and customers

Learn about client products and services to effectively represent and promote them

data.job_title: Digital Marketing Manager (Agency Lead) - US based
data.job_description:
Who we are: Founded in Lyon, France, in 2015, DataGalaxy has become the leading data catalog in France, connecting data, people, and AI through an intuitive data governance platform. Our mission is to simplify metadata mapping, management, and knowledge sharing to enhance organizational data governance and data literacy.

With more than 200 clients worldwide and rapidly growing, we are making significant strides in the US market, with the ambition to become a top 3 player in the data catalog space. Our teams span across two continents, fostering a dynamic international spirit that drives our innovation and growth.

Our mission: To lead the revolution in modern business data catalogs by empowering data professionals and business users through AI-driven data governance. As we expand rapidly in the US, we aim to set the standard for data and AI solutions, positioning ourselves as a trusted partner for navigating the complexities of a data-centric world across industries. Our vision is to drive impactful change and growth, particularly in the US market, as we shape the future of data governance on a global scale.

Our values: Be intentional. Be clear. Be bold. Be humble.

Why this role exists

DataGalaxy is scaling pipeline generation efficiently. We partner with agencies for SEO/paid media, PR, and web. We need a hands-on manager who can orchestrate those vendors, own performance, and build automated nurture experiences in HubSpot that turn awareness into opportunities.

Top 2 outcomes (first 12 months)
• Pipeline: Deliver $6M qualified pipeline attributed to digital (set quarterly targets with VP Marketing)
• Vendor performance: Stand up an agency scorecard and QBR process; hit SEO growth (non‑brand organic sessions +30% YoY) and paid efficiency (target CPL by segment and channel-specific ROI).

ResponsibilitiesVendor & channel ownership
• SEO: Own strategy with SEO agency; approve roadmap (tech SEO, content clusters, digital PR), prioritize briefs, and track leading indicators (crawl health, rankings, CTR) and lagging impact (organic demo requests).
• Paid media: Lead paid search & paid social agency; control budgets, audience strategy, messaging tests, and landing page briefs; instrument full‑funnel measurement and incrementality testing.
• PR/Comms: Direct PR partner on news calendar, thought leadership, and reporter relationships; align with content and analyst relations to amplify launches.
• Website: Manage web dev/design vendor for roadmap, UX experiments, CRO, and site health. Create clear acceptance criteria and QA for releases.

HubSpot Marketing Hub + CRM alignment
• Marketing automation and lead lifecycle (MQL, SAL, SQL definitions) in HubSpot; implement workflows, lead routing, and deduping; maintain data hygiene.
• Build multi‑touch nurture (persona, use case, stage) with branching logic, progressive profiling, email/SMS/in-app when relevant, and guardrails for frequency & fatigue.
• Organize attribution & reporting: define UTMs, campaign hierarchy, and dashboards for channel/creative/cohort performance.
• Create enablement for SDRs/AE: alerts, Slack notifications, snippets, and post‑demo nurture.

Measurement, process, and governance
• Establish monthly planning and QBRs with vendors; document SOPs and runbooks.
• Maintain budget, forecasts, pacing, and SOWs.
• Ensure compliance with privacy/consent (GDPR/CCPA), cookie management, and email deliverability best practices.

Qualifications
• 5–8+ years in B2B SaaS digital/growth; agency management experience across SEO, paid search/social, PR, and web is required.
• 3+ years hands‑on HubSpot (workflow automation, lead scoring/routing, campaign analytics).
• Content strategy for programmatic SEO and thought leadership with PR integration.
• Demonstrated ownership of pipeline targets and CAC/ROI; strong experimentation mindset (A/B, MVT).
• Working knowledge of GA4, Looker Studio (or BI), Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Search Console, Tag Manager, and CRO tools.
• Excellent brief writing, QA discipline, and project management; clear communicator across leadership and GTM.

Nice to have
• Experience in data governance/data catalog/data observability categories.
• ABM orchestration (lists, intent data, direct mail, paid social warm‑up, website personalization).

Success metrics
• Digital‑sourced pipeline and revenue vs. plan.
• Lead-to‑SQL conversion by segment and program.
• Non‑brand organic sessions, ranking velocity, and organic demo requests.
• Paid efficiency (CPL/CPA/ROAS/MER) and creative hit rate.
• Website conversion rate and experiment win rate.

DataGalaxy Offers a Number Of Advantages
• Health insurance 80% covered by DataGalaxy (medical, dental, and vision insurance)
• Mental health & wellness programs
• Full-remote work policy
• 21 PTO + 9 Bank Holiday
• 401(k) Retirement Plan
• Remote Equipment Expense Reimbursement
• 1 In-person Global Kick-off Event in France per year
• A real opportunity to join a French start-up that is a pioneer in its market

Location: Remote (US or EU time zones preferred)

Reports to: VP Marketing

Type: Full-time

For US Based Applicants

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $100,000 annually + bonus + benefits

Qualifications: 5–8+ years in B2B SaaS digital/growth; agency management experience across SEO, paid search/social, PR, and web is required
3+ years hands‑on HubSpot (workflow automation, lead scoring/routing, campaign analytics)
Content strategy for programmatic SEO and thought leadership with PR integration
Demonstrated ownership of pipeline targets and CAC/ROI; strong experimentation mindset (A/B, MVT)
Working knowledge of GA4, Looker Studio (or BI), Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Search Console, Tag Manager, and CRO tools
Excellent brief writing, QA discipline, and project management; clear communicator across leadership and GTM
Experience in data governance/data catalog/data observability categories
ABM orchestration (lists, intent data, direct mail, paid social warm‑up, website personalization)

Vendor performance: Stand up an agency scorecard and QBR process; hit SEO growth (non‑brand organic sessions +30% YoY) and paid efficiency (target CPL by segment and channel-specific ROI)

Full-remote work policy
21 PTO + 9 Bank Holiday
401(k) Retirement Plan
Remote Equipment Expense Reimbursement

A real opportunity to join a French start-up that is a pioneer in its market

Paid media: Lead paid search & paid social agency; control budgets, audience strategy, messaging tests, and landing page briefs; instrument full‑funnel measurement and incrementality testing
PR/Comms: Direct PR partner on news calendar, thought leadership, and reporter relationships; align with content and analyst relations to amplify launches

data.job_description:
Description

Who We Are:

Raben is a public policy, strategic communications and organizational consulting firm. Our talented and passionate team champions diversity, equity, and justice as core values that ignite our mission for impactful change in corporate, nonprofit, government, and foundation work. Our changemakers work to solve real-world problems and inspire lasting changes through our four service offerings: strategic communications, government affairs, issue campaigns, and culture, strategy, & organizational design.

We have been fueled by insightful strategy, creative tactics, and plain old hustle for over 20 years. We are a majority-minority firm as we are people of color, women, immigrants, disabled, and LGBTQ. Spend time with us and you will quickly learn we value smarts, creativity, and audaciousness in just about all we do... and a sense of humor is a contractual must. Learn more at raben.co.

What We Seek:

We are seeking a talented and creative Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our team in our Washington, DC office. In this role, you will be responsible for managing our social media platforms, creating engaging graphics and visual content, and developing templates for various marketing materials. This role will spend approximately 60% of time on in-house digital marketing and 40% of time on client service engagements. This position is located in our DC office and follows a hybrid schedule with two days per week in office.

Responsibilities:
• Plan, execute, and manage both organic and paid social media campaigns for Raben and our clients.
• Maintain and oversee multiple social media platforms, including Instagram, LinkedIn, X, Facebook and TikTok.
• Make updates to the Raben website as needed. Utilize software such as Canva and the Adobe Suite to Facebook and TikTok.
• Make updates to Raben website as needed. Utilize software such as Canva and the Adobe Suite to design eye-catching graphics and visual content for social media, email campaigns, and digital advertisements.
• Develop templates for marketing materials, such as presentations, proposals, and internal and external documents and manage the day-to-day design elements of all proposals.
• Collaborate with the marketing team to create cohesive and consistent branding across all digital platforms.
• Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in social media, graphic design, and digital marketing.
• Assist with social media & audio-visual needs at Raben events.

Requirements

Requirements:
• Previous work experience or coursework in marketing, communications or a related field.
• 2+ years of experience in social media management, graphic design, or digital marketing.
• Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, and other design software.
• Photography and video editing skills are a plus.
• Strong understanding of social media platforms and best practices.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Application Instructions:

To apply, please submit an application, resume, and portfolio via our online job portal. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered. If you need accommodations during the recruitment process, please email your needs to careers@raben.co.

Salary Range and Benefits:

Our salary range for this role is between $55,000-$58,000 per year, commensurate with experience and locality. In addition to a great degree of autonomy in work and projects, our colleagues enjoy a suite of benefits such as health, dental, and vision insurance, unlimited PTO, monthly data plan reimbursements, flexibility in work location and schedule, a rich professional development curriculum, a 3% 401K match, yearly employer FSA contribution, work from home flexibility, and many more.

COVID-19 Policy:

Regardless of work location, all staff of Raben must show proof of having received an FDA authorized COVID-19 vaccination or provide a medical or religious exemption. New employees must provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or exemption no later than their first day of employment.

Raben finds it quite natural to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, aspiring to live the values of equity in everything we do.

Qualifications: Previous work experience or coursework in marketing, communications or a related field
2+ years of experience in social media management, graphic design, or digital marketing
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, and other design software
Strong understanding of social media platforms and best practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Benefits: Our salary range for this role is between $55,000-$58,000 per year, commensurate with experience and locality

In addition to a great degree of autonomy in work and projects, our colleagues enjoy a suite of benefits such as health, dental, and vision insurance, unlimited PTO, monthly data plan reimbursements, flexibility in work location and schedule, a rich professional development curriculum, a 3% 401K match, yearly employer FSA contribution, work from home flexibility, and many more
Responsibilities: In this role, you will be responsible for managing our social media platforms, creating engaging graphics and visual content, and developing templates for various marketing materials
This role will spend approximately 60% of time on in-house digital marketing and 40% of time on client service engagements
Plan, execute, and manage both organic and paid social media campaigns for Raben and our clients
Maintain and oversee multiple social media platforms, including Instagram, LinkedIn, X, Facebook and TikTok
Make updates to the Raben website as needed
Utilize software such as Canva and the Adobe Suite to Facebook and TikTok
Make updates to Raben website as needed
Utilize software such as Canva and the Adobe Suite to design eye-catching graphics and visual content for social media, email campaigns, and digital advertisements
Develop templates for marketing materials, such as presentations, proposals, and internal and external documents and manage the day-to-day design elements of all proposals
Collaborate with the marketing team to create cohesive and consistent branding across all digital platforms
Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in social media, graphic design, and digital marketing
Assist with social media & audio-visual needs at Raben events

data.job_description:
Responsibilities:
• Manage digital marketing campaigns across a variety of industries and clients
• Write content for blogs, social media, digital ads, email drip campaigns, guides, and websites
• Perform keyword research for SEO purposes and optimize content accordingly
• Create and monitor social media ads and ad spend; perform A/B testing as needed
• Work within clients’ CMS, email marketing platform, and social media accounts
• Analyze data and campaign analytics for monthly client reports
• Maintain enthusiasm and urgency in servicing clients while consistently striving for excellence
• Design basic graphics for use in social media content, email blasts, guides, websites, and reports

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree (marketing, communications, business, or related fields)
• 2-3+ years of hands-on experience in digital marketing; preferably agency experience
• Familiarity and comfort with CMS platforms (WordPress experience highly preferred)
• Proven ability to create engaging and branded content for clients (blogs and social media)
• Experience with email marketing campaigns and software (MailChimp preferred)
• Experience with Google Analytics and data/social listening and analytics tools
• Unrelenting attention to detail
• Outstanding writing and self-editing ability
• Exceptional organizational skills and time management
• Beginner level design skills or understanding (Canva experience a plus)

Perfect Candidate:
• Is incredibly smart, charismatic, and a natural conversationalist
• Has an entrepreneurial spirit and loves to work hard/play hard
• Is strategic, creative, and analytical
• Has a genuine interest in marketing and keeps up with industry trends
• Is a self-starter, takes pride in their work, and generally gives a damn

data.job_description:
Note: this job is posted in multiple location for marketing purposes, but only one opening is available.

Are you…

Interested in working for an international and diverse company?

Interested in working for a company that is dedicated to sustainability?

Looking for a friendly and supporting team?

If so, read on!

Protecting water, the most valuable resource, and driving sustainability is very close to our hearts. You will be part of a flexible, family friendly organization that cares about its people just as it cares about the environment.

Learn more about us! https://www.veralto.com/company/sea-bird-scientific/

We offer:

Benefits starting day 1, including medical/dental/vision, 401k with company matching

Annual Performance-Based Bonuses

Career coaching and development opportunities

With PPTO, you will have the flexibility to take time off when you need it and without needing to track it. Working with your manager, you can decide when and why to take time off. We trust that you will take the time you need, while also managing the needs of customers, colleagues, and the organization.

The Digital Marketing Specialist (DMS) executes the demand generation and growth marketing strategy, in partnership with other members of the Marketing team. This hands on, dynamic role in the marketing organization is focused on leveraging digital channels to drive qualified leads, communicate with customers to drive awareness and consideration, and optimize our digital tools and systems to drive growth.

The DMS will report to the Growth Marketing Manager, based in the Seattle, WA area.

This position is
remote,
and
travel may be required,

for up to 20% of the time.

Have a passion for diving in, getting your hands dirty and making a real impact? Step right up!

In this role, a typical day will look like:

Web Presence:
Develop web content and execute all web updates to ensure consistency of voice, brand standards, and digital strategy

Email Marketing:
Own execution of email campaigns to acquire new customers and move existing customers through the customer journey

Marketing Automation:
Leverage the power of Marketing Automation to deliver on our digital strategy and execute CRM marketing campaigns

SEO & Paid Search:
Optimize Sea-Bird Scientific’s web presence for SEO and implement paid search campaigns with a focus on ROI

Systems & Technology:
Own the daily operation and interaction with a suite of MarTech solutions to generate demand and drive growth

Cross-Team Collaboration:
Working with other members of the marketing team to heighten the impact of brand, offline, social, and process improvement projects

The essential requirements of the job include:

Bachelor’s degree required

Experience in digital marketing for technical products

Experience with MarTech tools (like Marketo, Salesforce, reporting and analytics, GA4, PPC, CMS, Wordpress)

Ability to travel 20% of the time, domestic and international travel is required

It would be great if you also possess:

Completed, in-progress or willingness to start Marketo Certification a plus

A passion for the ocean and climate science goes a long way

Qualifications: for up to 20% of the time
Bachelor’s degree required
Experience in digital marketing for technical products
Experience with MarTech tools (like Marketo, Salesforce, reporting and analytics, GA4, PPC, CMS, Wordpress)
Ability to travel 20% of the time, domestic and international travel is required
A passion for the ocean and climate science goes a long way
Benefits: Benefits starting day 1, including medical/dental/vision, 401k with company matching
Annual Performance-Based Bonuses
Career coaching and development opportunities
With PPTO, you will have the flexibility to take time off when you need it and without needing to track it
Working with your manager, you can decide when and why to take time off

This hands on, dynamic role in the marketing organization is focused on leveraging digital channels to drive qualified leads, communicate with customers to drive awareness and consideration, and optimize our digital tools and systems to drive growth

data.job_description: Join to apply for the Digital Marketing Specialist role at Alarm.com. Alarm.com is seeking a dynamic and innovative Digital Marketing Specialist with proven experience in web content management, search engine optimization (SEO), and A/B testing to drive high-impact digital marketing strategies. In this key role, you will combine creative and technical skills to support the Alarm.com Marketing Department by developing compelling, optimized content and closely analyzing performance data. You will evaluate content effectiveness through keyword rankings, organic traffic growth, conversion rates, and other SEO metrics, using insights to refine strategies and maximize online visibility and engagement. Responsibilities Web Content Management Update and manage web content using CMS tools such as WordPress and Craft. Create, edit, and optimize content for web pages, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines and SEO best practices. Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and implement content calendars. Design and execute A/B optimization tests to increase the effectiveness of marketing strategies, landing pages, and user experiences. Monitor and analyze content performance metrics to provide actionable insights that drive continuous improvement and higher conversion rates. Utilize Google Analytics to track and report on site performance. SEO Programs Conduct keyword research and implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies. Perform ongoing keyword discovery and expansion. Optimize website content and structure to improve visibility in AI-driven search results. Utilize SEO tools such as Google Search Console, SEMrush, or Ahrefs to monitor and improve site performance. Email Marketing Collaborate with the team to develop and implement targeted email marketing campaigns. Monitor and analyze email campaign performance metrics and provide insights and recommendations to optimize future campaigns and improve engagement rates. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications 3+ years of experience in digital marketing, SEO, and content management. Hands-on experience with SEO tools and A/B testing platforms. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Certifications in Google Analytics (preferred). Experience with project management tools like JIRA and Confluence. Email marketing experience, including creating campaigns, analyzing performance data, and optimizing strategies. Knowledge of AI algorithms and tools to enhance search engine rankings (preferred). Note: Sponsorship for new applicants for employment authorization, or any other immigration-related support, is not available for this position at this time. Benefits Competitive pay and benefits, including a subsidized medical plan, HSA, 401(k) with employer match, paid holidays, wellness time, and vacation increasing with tenure. Paid maternity and bonding leave, company-paid disability and life insurance, FSAs, well-being resources and activities. Casual dress work environment. Employees work from the office 4 days a week. About Alarm.com Alarm.com is the leading cloud-based platform for smart security and the Internet of Things. More than 7.6?million home and business owners depend on our solutions every day to make their properties safer, smarter, and more efficient. Were seeking passionate individuals who want to create lasting impact on the world through technology. Visit www.alarm.com for more information. Equal Opportunity Employer Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. #J-18808-Ljbffr

Qualifications: Qualifications 3+ years of experience in digital marketing, SEO, and content management
Hands-on experience with SEO tools and A/B testing platforms
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with project management tools like JIRA and Confluence
Email marketing experience, including creating campaigns, analyzing performance data, and optimizing strategies
Benefits: Benefits Competitive pay and benefits, including a subsidized medical plan, HSA, 401(k) with employer match, paid holidays, wellness time, and vacation increasing with tenure
Paid maternity and bonding leave, company-paid disability and life insurance, FSAs, well-being resources and activities
Employees work from the office 4 days a week
